org.apache.juneau.json

Class JsonSerializerContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.Context
      • org.apache.juneau.serializer.SerializerContext
        • org.apache.juneau.json.JsonSerializerContext

  • public final class JsonSerializerContext
extends SerializerContext
    Configurable properties on the JsonSerializer class.

    Context properties are set by calling ContextFactory.setProperty(String, Object) on the context factory returned CoreApi.getContextFactory().

    The following convenience methods are also provided for setting context properties:

    • JsonSerializer.setProperty(String,Object)
    • JsonSerializer.setProperties(ObjectMap)
    • JsonSerializer.addNotBeanClasses(Class[])
    • JsonSerializer.addTransforms(Class[])
    • JsonSerializer.addImplClass(Class,Class)

    See ContextFactory for more information about context properties.

    Author:
    James Bognar (james.bognar@salesforce.com)

    • Field Detail

      • JSON_simpleMode

        public static final String JSON_simpleMode
        Simple JSON mode (Boolean, default=false).

        If true, JSON attribute names will only be quoted when necessary. Otherwise, they are always quoted.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JSON_useWhitespace

        public static final String JSON_useWhitespace
        Use whitespace in output (Boolean, default=false).

        If true, whitespace is added to the output to improve readability.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JSON_escapeSolidus

        public static final String JSON_escapeSolidus
        Prefix solidus '/' characters with escapes (Boolean, default=false).

        If true, solidus (e.g. slash) characters should be escaped. The JSON specification allows for either format. However, if you're embedding JSON in an HTML script tag, this setting prevents confusion when trying to serialize <\/script>.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

        public JsonSerializerContext(ContextFactory cf)
        Constructor.

        Typically only called from ContextFactory.getContext(Class).

        Parameters:
        cf - The factory that created this context.
